organic_results.title: Organizational differentiation of students and educational opportunity
organic_results.snippet: Organizational differentiation of students is defined as the division of a school's student-body into subgroups (classes, sections, streams) of a relatively permanent character for instructional purposes. A vast body of research exists on the effect of organizational differentiation, especially the effects of grouping according to ability. No coherent pattern of results emerges from this research. It is argued in this paper that the inconclusiveness of the research is due not only to methodological problems, but also to the theoretical meagerness …
